page.title: 04Hall Farm
page.content: There are 1500 acres managed by Mr. Bond, with a herd of 170 Friesian cows and one bull. Each cow has one calf a year which is taken away from its mother immediately. The cows like to be milked at the same time every day and like to be fed at the same time and like to have the same pen. The milking parlour can hold 16 cows at a time. When the cows are being milked they eat food called cake. In winter the cows stay in a shed and are fed on silage which is made out of grass and maize which are grown here. Other crops include Wheat and Oilseed Rape. The farm includes the Tindall Wood, designated as an ancient wood. Nearby is the moated farm house of Tindall Hall Farm.
